channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1695; 10:35PM; 8304 S Broadway St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Lq1yQF; #Florence; Thirty firefighters responded to the site of a previous burn, and began with defensive firefighter tactics. They quickly knocked back the intense flames and transitioned to offensive tactics, advancing hose lines inside the burning structure. Overall, it took 14 minutes to extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC11 BC13 BC4 CM20 CM22 E205 E233 E264 E266 E27 E33 E46 E57 E64 E65 EA1 EM13 HR3 RA257 RA33 RA857 T33 T5 T64 T66 UR5 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1695; 10:21PM; 8304 S Broadway St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Lq1yQF; #Florence; One-story commercial structure with heavy fire showing. Defensive mode.; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E233 E33 E57 E64 RA257 T33; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

title.a: CONTAINED Greater Alarm Brush Fire 06/22/2023 INC#1157

item.description: CONTAINED Greater Alarm Brush Fire; INC#1157; 05:50PM; 25000 W Kittridge St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3CGAzMI; #WestHills; With 10 mph winds and steep terrain, approximately 100 LAFD firefighters, along with LAFD Crew 3 and LACoFD firefighters, anchored the fire and quickly deployed ground crews to both flanks, before "pinching" around the fire front to stop progress before the uphill homes became damaged. With support from water-dropping aircraft, firefighters extinguished the approximately two-acre brush fire in 79 minutes. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 105; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 CW3A E100 E104 E105 E106 E107 E273 E290 E293 E296 E305 E73 E83 E84 E90 E93 EM17 H2 H3 H7 HA2 HA3 HA7 HE1 HT3 RA106 RA96 T105 T73 T90 T93 T96; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Major Emergency Structure Fire 06/22/2023 INC#1024

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#1024; 04:47PM; 728 S San Pedro St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3XkDVOQ; #DowntownLA; Firefighters arrived to the Flower District of Downtown Los Angeles to find heavy fire involving outside storage in the rear, and a two-story mixed-occupancy building, with a row of commercials on the first floor and residential units above that, both occupied at the time. Firefighters immediately called for reinforcements upon seeing the blaze. The Incident Commander divided tasks between crews to take care of interior fire attack, rooftop ventilation, interior search, and evacuation of the occupied buildings. It took 148 firefighters one hour and 35 minutes to extinguish the flames. Thankfully, only one person (28-year-old female) was transported to the hospital in fair condition, and a second (50-year-old male) was evaluated and released (both had symptoms of smoke inhalation). Four commercial units and the respective residential units above them sustained fire damage. Approximately 30 residents will be displaced. Red Cross is responding to assist. No firefighter injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR30 AR33 AR38 AR7 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC14 BC18 BC2 BC5 CE59 CM20 CM21 CM22 E1 E10 E11 E13 E14 E15 E17 E2 E201 E202 E203 E209 E210 E211 E220 E221 E226 E227 E3 E4 E9 EA1 EM1 EM13 EM5 HR3 PH1 PI1 RA10 RA11 RA17 RA2 RA25 RA3 RA803 RA9 SQ21 T1 T10 T11 T2 T20 T21 T26 T27 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13 14 16; Nicholas Prange

Brush Fire; INC#1157; 04:31PM; 25000 W Kittridge St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3CGAzMI; #WestHills; Approximately two acres of fire in medium-to-heavy brush burning uphill near Knapp Ranch Park.; FS 105; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 CW3A E100 E104 E105 E106 E107 E273 E290 E293 E296 E305 E73 E83 E84 E93 EM17 H2 H3 H7 HA2 HA3 HA7 HE1 RA96 T105 T73 T90 T93 T96; CH5; 17; Nicholas Prange

Update Structure Fire; INC#1024; 04:08PM; 728 S San Pedro St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3XkDVOQ; #DowntownLA; A large outside rubbish fire spread to several businesses in a row of commercial buildings, which had occupied residential units across the second floor. LAFD has approximately 148 firefighters on scene, making good progress. Firefighters have ascended ladders to the roof to cut ventilation holes, as crews deploy hose streams below. Firefighters are entering businesses on either side to prevent any further horizontal spread. No reported injuries.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR30 AR33 AR38 AR7 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC14 BC18 BC2 BC5 CE59 CM20 CM21 CM22 E1 E10 E11 E13 E14 E15 E17 E2 E201 E202 E203 E209 E210 E211 E220 E221 E226 E227 E3 E4 E9 EA1 EM1 EM13 EM5 HR3 PI1 RA10 RA11 RA17 RA2 RA25 RA3 RA803 RA9 SQ21 T1 T10 T11 T2 T20 T21 T26 T27 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14 16; Nicholas Prange

PIO Captain Erik Scott en route.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC14 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E14 E209 E210 E211 E221 E227 E3 E4 E9 EM1 EM13 EM5 HR3 RA10 RA11 RA25 RA3 RA9 SQ21 T10 T11 T21 T27 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1668; 10:56PM; 4126 S Figueroa St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3CErOTk; Vermont Square; KNOCKDOWN: Firefighters contained the bulk of the fire to the 2nd floor (converted attic) of the craftsman home (possibly vacant). Crews defended the exposed apartment building from fire extension. There is some minor damage to window coverings. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details. A total of over 80 firefighters were assigned to the incident however, knockdown was achieved (23 minutes) prior to arrival of all added resources. ; FS 46; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E203 E210 E215 E221 E233 E266 E27 E33 E46 E66 EM11 HR3 RA246 RA46 RA803 RA815 RA846 SQ21 T10 T15 T21 T3 T33 T66 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13 14; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1668; 10:33PM; 4126 S Figueroa St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3CErOTk; Vermont Square; One story craftsman style home, well involved in fire. There is at least one structure (3 story apartment building) exposed. ; FS 46; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E203 E210 E215 E221 E266 E27 E33 E46 E66 EM11 HR3 RA246 RA815 RA846 SQ21 T10 T15 T21 T3 T66 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Chemical Spill; INC#1488; 09:02PM; 1111 S Earle St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3NHs5es; San Pedro; A total of 15 patients were affected by the fumes of a ship off loading fuel. Only one patient is being transported (age/gender unknown) in fair condition. All others declined LAFD transport. There is no evidence of any spills in the water or on the ground. LAFD resources will be conducting a final test of the atmosphere surrounding the area impacted and then clearing the scene. No further details.; FS 40; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 BT1 E238 E248 E36 E40 E48 RA112 RA36 RA848 RA864 RA865 SQ48 T38 T48; CH7; 12; Margaret Stewart
